title: 3.8.4: quarkus.analytics.disabled ignored + command line answer not processed

labels.name: area/devtools
labels.description: Issues/PR related to maven, gradle, platform and cli tooling/plugins

labels.name: triage/consider-closing
labels.description: Bugs that are considered to be closed because too old. Using the label to do a mark and sweep proces

body:
Seems like `quarkus.analytics.disabled` just does nothing.

`quarkus.analytics.disabled` is set to false (both in application.yaml and application-dev-yaml):

![image](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/assets/160733883/ffc97d03-8c60-4a30-a93a-e43c28d25ecf)

Config value itself is correctly set:
![image](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/assets/160733883/36417bfe-4a66-4b6d-b38a-5fad93b26cd5)

... but ignored by Quarkus:
![image](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/assets/160733883/c6326a9a-9b29-4f34-9506-a19cfb7ecb2e)

Even trying to answer the question via the console is not working, the input is not scanned:

![image](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/assets/160733883/a01f5007-1cd8-446a-9d33-2a1d07e4a966)

_Originally posted by @rupert-jung-mw in https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/issues/34626#issuecomment-2185933766_
